Description: Hollow terracotta figure of Harpokrates, seated with legs extending to his right; he leans on his pot, held in his left hand, with his right hand inside its mouth. He is naked and macrophallic, the glans resting on the plinth, and his head is shaven except for a side-lock; lotus buds rise on top of his head; between them he wears a Double Crown. Curved plain-fronted plinth. Back plain except for a raised rim round a circular vent. Two-piece mould. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt. Traces of a white dressing, mainly on the front.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Ptolemaic, third to second century BC. Comparanda: Close (probably same mould-series): registration no. 1849,0811.7; Dunand 1990: no. 117, dated Roman period; Skupinska-Løvset 1978: no. UT 124, dated second century BC; Török 1995: no. 72, dated late Hellenistic or later; Weber 1914: no. 65. Near: Bayer-Niemeier 1988: nos 36 and 39 (alien head), from the Fayum, dated first century BC; Dunand 1979: no. 136; Engelbach et al. 1915: pl. lxi:45(1), from a terracotta shop at Memphis: perhaps Petrie Museum uc8783; Gabold 1990: 81, no. 057; Hilton Price 1897: 391, no. 3250, from the Fayum; Kaufmann 1913: fig. 31:4.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3058)
